title: Five Nights At Freddy's 4

headings.text: How to Play Five Nights At Freddy's 4

controls: Move mouse left or right to check doors.Move mouse to the bed to check for Nightmare Freddy's minions.Click and hold to shut doors.Hold left click to use the flashlight.
content.howToPlay: Your goal is to survive five nights, lasting from midnight to 6 AM.You play as a young child haunted by nightmare animatronics that creep closer with every passing hour.Listen carefully for breathing or footsteps, which signal their presence near the doors.Shut doors when necessary or risk a jumpscare.Keep checking the bed behind you—Nightmare Freddy's minions are always waiting for an opportunity to strike.Each night becomes more challenging as the animatronics grow faster and more aggressive.Bonus: During the first two nights, play a minigame where you must catch Scraptrap sitting on a chair. Successfully pin him on the X mark to gain a two-hour advantage during your night shift.
content.developer: FNAF 4 was created by Scott Cawthon.

fullContent: Home› HorrorFive Nights At Freddy's 4By OnlineGames.ioMake Game Full ScreenPrepare yourself for the most terrifying chapter in the Five Nights at Freddy's series! FNaF 4 takes the series from the familiar security office to the unsettling confines of a child's bedroom, where nightmarish animatronics lurk in the shadows. It's intimate, it's personal, and it's terrifying because the monsters are now in your own home.The gameplay mechanics have evolved. With no cameras or power systems to rely on, survival comes down to your instincts. You're now listening for the breathing of nightmarish creatures. And I believe this mechanic takes FNAF 4 beyond looking around. The game is not just about looking anymore; it's about listening, which adds a whole new layer of panic. Every creak and breath could signal danger. You may find yourself asking, "Did I hear that, or was it just the house settling? Oh, it's just my last shred of sanity leaving the room."So, it's a game where the only thing between you and a horrifying jumpscare is your ability to react quickly. Can you survive the five nights of nightmares, or will the darkness claim you?ControlsMove mouse left or right to check doors.Move mouse to the bed to check for Nightmare Freddy's minions.Click and hold to shut doors.Hold left click to use the flashlight.How to Play Five Nights At Freddy's 4Your goal is to survive five nights, lasting from midnight to 6 AM.You play as a young child haunted by nightmare animatronics that creep closer with every passing hour.Listen carefully for breathing or footsteps, which signal their presence near the doors.Shut doors when necessary or risk a jumpscare.Keep checking the bed behind you—Nightmare Freddy's minions are always waiting for an opportunity to strike.Each night becomes more challenging as the animatronics grow faster and more aggressive.Bonus: During the first two nights, play a minigame where you must catch Scraptrap sitting on a chair. Explore other horror games from the FNAF franchise on OnlineGames.io and keep the fright alive!Five Nights at Freddy’sFive Nights at Freddy’s 2Five Nights at Freddy’s 3Editor's ReviewOpinions about FNAF 4 are as varied as the game's jumpscares. Some fans adore the new atmosphere and the shift in gameplay, while others miss the old security camera mechanic. Especially fans who rely on rigid, muscle-memory tactics—constantly checking vents, using flashlights music boxes, and masks—may find themselves disoriented in FNAF 4, as these familiar tools are stripped away. It's because the lack of tools is forcing them to adapt to a new kind of horror where the player is more vulnerable.However, I believe this vulnerability is exactly what Scott Cawthon aimed to create—an experience where players feel exposed and isolated in ways the previous games never had. Whether you love it for its intensity or critique it for its simplicity, it undeniably left an impact, much like a well-timed jump scare at 2 AM.So, in the grand scheme of things, years from now, we might still remember FNAF 4 as the game that made us check under our beds... just to be sure, guys... just to be sure...This article was updated on April 22, 20251 Player2DActionAvoidCrazyFreeHorrorSurvival
